Certainly! Here are some recommended resources and activities for a 12th-grade Calculus lesson on the topic of Derivation:

1. Resource: Khan Academy - Derivatives
   - Activity: Assign specific videos and practice exercises from Khan Academy's Calculus section that cover different aspects of derivatives. For example, recommend watching the videos on "Definition of Derivative" and "Derivative Rules," and assign practice problems related to finding derivatives of various functions.

2. Resource: Calculus-Help.com - Derivatives Worksheet
   - Activity: Provide a link to the Calculus-Help.com website's "Derivatives Worksheet," which offers a set of problems for students to practice finding derivatives using different rules and techniques.

3. Resource: MathIsFun.com - Derivative Practice Exercises
   - Activity: Have students visit MathIsFun.com's Calculus section and complete the derivative practice exercises available on the website. These exercises cover various types of functions and help reinforce the concept of finding derivatives.

4. Resource: YouTube - "Introduction to Derivatives"
   - Activity: Encourage students to watch a specific video on YouTube titled "Introduction to Derivatives." You can search for this video on YouTube by typing "Introduction to Derivatives" and selecting a video with positive feedback and clear explanations.

Remember to adapt these resources and activities to fit your specific lesson objectives and the needs of your students. Let me know if you need any further assistance!
